questions.question_text:
A customer wants to upgrade a PC's internal storage to have more room to store backups, photos, and videos. The new storage should be large enough to avoid expanding again next year.
Which of the following BEST meets these needs?

discussion.content:
3TB HDD is plenty of storage space to not need to expand for several years, realistically.
512GB SSD is quick to access but may cost more than a HDD and has very limited space by comparison.
50GB NAS and 500TB SAN are both external solutions and do not meet the criteria.

The questions specifies that the user is looking for "internal storage", so we know that it can't be NAS (Network Attached Storage) or SAN (Storage Area Network). Next, the question specifies that the user is more worried about storage SIZE rather than SPEED. Therefore, we should avoid the 512 GB SSD and go for the 3 TB HDD.

NFC - Haptic Confirmation for sharing data wirelessly.
IR - Devices are placed in close proximity within line of sight for sharing data wirelessly.

questions.question_text: Joe, a user, reports that airplane mode is enabled on his smartphone when he is flying. Joe wants to be able to use the airline's Internet service without disabling airplane mode. Which of the following can Joe perform to achieve this goal?

choices.A: Pair the smartphone with an LTE hotspot
choices.B: Enable WiFi after enabling airplane mode
choices.D: Set up tethering to a personal laptop
choices.C: Install the airline's official mobile application

questions.question_text: A user replaced a failed CPU on a desktop PC. During post-repair testing, the PC shut off shortly after a successful POST and before the OS could fully load. The user calls a technician for assistance. Which of the following should the technician perform FIRST?

choices.D: Look for BIOS updates from the manufacturer
choices.B: Check the motherboard for distended capacitors
choices.C: Verify processor compatibility with the motherboard

discussion.content: It could literally be either. Which is easier to check? Thermal paste or CPU compatibility?
I think is A as well.

comments.content: precisely. i'd be like, "did u apply the paste that came with the cpu?" or "did u apply a paste before you slapped it on?". before i'll even ask for the details of that new cpu to cross check it with the motherboard he just installed it on.

discussion.content: answer is A; OBJ-4.1: On-demand is considered one of the five cloud computing concepts. On-demand refers to the fact that a consumer can unilaterally provision computing capabilities, such as server time and network storage, as needed automatically without requiring human interaction with each service provider. In this question, the cloud storage is provisioned and deprovisioned automatically for the user, and thereby it would be categorized as on-demand.

On-demand self-service: The customers can assign themselves computing resources as needed. ... Resource pooling: Computing resources are combined to serve multiple customers with different physical and virtual resources dynamically assigned and reassigned according to demand

comments.content: You may want to read into OneDrive and the "Files On-Demand" feature.

discussion.content: I believe the answer is 'B'. There's no discussion on this one.

questions.question_text: The feature that allows users to store files in cloud-based storage when necessary, but can be removed when space is freed up, is known as:
